ETYMOLOGY: From English 'realize' (from Old French 'réaliser', from 'réel' 'real') + '-ation' (suffix forming nouns of action or process).

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The fulfillment or achievement of something desired or anticipated.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 梦想、计划或目标等的实现或达成。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The realization of her lifelong dream of becoming a doctor brought her immense joy.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 实现她成为医生的毕生梦想带给她巨大的喜悦。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The sudden or gradual understanding or recognition of a fact or situation.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 对某事物的突然或逐渐的理解或认识。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: There was a dawning realization that he had made a terrible mistake.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他逐渐意识到自己犯了一个严重的错误。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The conversion of an asset or property into money.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 将资产或财产转换为现金。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The realization of the company's assets took longer than expected.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 公司资产的变现花费了比预期更长的时间。
